title: Just destroy tank ekko please
body:
I get that riot wants to support a variety of builds and that's really cool on the champions it works on.

Ekko is not one of them. Tank ekko just removes most of his actual weaknesses and isn't remotely fun to play against. Riot's tried to nerf it in a way that keeps it viable, and the result is that it's still his best build and it's still stupid to play against.

At some point you have to just prioritize fixing the problem over leaving the offbuild viable. Just bite the bullet and make it so that tank ekko isn't even remotely viable, and then buff his AP playstyle if it's too weak.

Well if this is the case I was using outdated data, and I'm sorry.

IMO, he needs his base stats adjusted to better accentuate the fact that he's supposed to be an assassin.  Rework his base health, armor and magic resistance.  From there, he should also have his utility evaluated.  He has what, two slows, a stun, two blinks and a shield? 

I personally find that absurd for a character that's supposed to pick off targets.  The slows he provides are both 60 percent, which is also on the higher end of the spectrum.  Perhaps start by dropping them to 30-40 percent.  Maybe even remove the slow from his passive entirely.  It doesn't make sense that he not only gets additional damage, but is also rewarded with a slow that further cements his ability to stick to a target, IN ADDITION to boosting his movement speed massively.  They don't even get the option to juke his Q, which guess what? - has another slow.
Overloaded kit. I think that the passive needs to be reworked to be assassin like: no slow, no ms, just some kind of damage. AP based critical strike perhaps? Suits for an assassin.

But his entire concept is to be a utility assassin. He doesnt deal as much damage reliably as real assassins but makes up for it with his utility, right now his slow values are too strong and allows him to set his team up too easily also the way people talk about him it sounds like they think his w is easy to land, Ekko might seem strong if he initiates a fight because he can control zones well but defensively all he really has is his ult and op slow.

"Utility" "Assassin"
Pick One

I think it's perfectly possible to pick two, you just have to make sure you mix them together properly.

Which is to say, something that gets into the backline easy and disrupts the hell out of them but is vulnerable and reliant on the frontline being distracted unless fed to one-shot levels. Or something that is constantly flowing through a fight, buffing their allies while debuffing their enemies. Or something that's basically an Anivia, Zyra, or Orianna that trades in range for mobility.

Just because there's one obnoxious example of this combination doesn't mean it can't work. A lot of mages have both damage and utility, and they still work out perfectly fine despite getting all that and range too.

I think a fair trade off would be to give his slows and stun a base value, and, similar to lulu whimsy, have them scale up with AP. I'm not for the "gut ekko" crowd but at the same time a 2.25 second stun that you dont really have to rank up is a bit much. Most other champions' CCs scale with level. Even swain was brought into line very recently with his w.

Main thing is that people feel like this'll either cause two things to happen: you'll either cause AP Ekko to have insufferable amounts of both utility and damage, or you'll just end up gutting Ekko anyway because his early game is pretty bad even as tank Ekko and you've basically got yourself a dead champion.

And, honestly, I see those both far more likely results than Ekko being put into a healthy spot.

The problem is that Riot is only nerfing tank Ekko's damage, but that's not the only issue with him. His utility is off the charts, which isn't an issue against ap Ekko since he's squishy. However, on a tank Ekko, he can just apply his cc to everyone on the enemy team while dealing damage, and his utility and tankiness gives him plenty of safety both in lane and in teamfights. This is what Riot should be focused on when balancing tank Ekko: **_MAKE HIS CC SCALE WITH AP_**

Food for thought:

If all he has is his immense utility without any (burst) damage, what does Ekko provide? A stun, some slows, a self heal to stay alive, and dive potential.

Yes, Ekko can "just apply his cc to everyone on the enemy team while dealing damage." Doesnt Nautilus, Sejuani, Malphite, and Amumu do the exact same thing?

The difference is that ekko does more damage than most of those champions and can get to and stick to a priority target much better because of the low cooldown on his E.

You can kite an amumu. You can't really kite a halfway competent ekko.

I'm almost certain Amumu and Sejuani deal more damage than tank Ekko, between having %health damage and either actually having relevant scalings or built-in resistance shred, plus just plain having comparable or better bases.

Though the point of being able to kite either of them, especially Amumu, far better than you can Ekko is a good point. Although in terms of reliably, Ekko loses a lot of damage because if you're trying to kite Ekko, chances are he can't ult for damage and whoops there goes most of his damage output.

Hell, I just checked Malphite. He seems to have a similar level of damage, but more reliable outside of his attack steroid, and trying to kite a Malphite with IBG is a pain between the proc and the reduced cooldown Q. And suddenly his W steroid is more reliable than Ekko R.
Not even close. The bases may be comparable, but the CD's are not.

Thing is none of them have high amounts of mobility and escapes, that once they dedicate themselves they have to go in. Furthermore if you escape or avoid the initial skill shot (Nautilus and Ammumu) then they can't really go in. Some of those are also prone to counter junglers since Ammumu and Sejuani are often picked jungle. 

I'm not gonna comment on whether or not Nautilus is balanced but I can say that all of those champions have weaknesses that Ekko doesn't have. To reach you it's a point and click. He can throw an AOE field which can slow you and stun you if you wait long enough while granting him a shield, an ult to escape a skirmish and a slow with a MS steroid as a passive. To top it all off his abilities are spammable.

Other champions have weaknesses that Ekko doesnt have, but Ekko has weaknesses they dont have. Ekko doesnt have the immediate tankiness, reliable hard CC, or the AoE of the other champions. Other champions dont have to predict a 3-second casttime for their only form of hard CC. Other champions dont use their only strong burst spell defensively because its so unreliable to use offensively.

You don't exactly need the hard CC or to be tankier than other tanks to win. Ekko wins as a tank simply because even if you have a bigger buffer tank than Ekko, you don't exactly have to out trade that tank. You can very well target squishies and out trade them easily and stick to them if they survive because of what's in his kit.

 Some tanks don't even have hard CC and just simply have high damage in their kit like {{champion:86}} with some mobility. You see other tanks if they go in with their initiation they generally do not have an escape take malphite and nautilus for example. Ekko's is strong but it's better to be used in those very sticky situations because his other abilities are very spammable.

So, Tank Ekko has damage, utility, and tankiness. While not totally inaccurate, there is a good reason to build AP already, that being damage *and* heal/shield (or tankiness). In fact, here's a rundown of his AP ratios:

Passive (80% damage per 3 hits)
Q out (10% damage)
Q in (60% damage)
W passive (3% damage in %HP when below 40% HP)
W shield (150% shield)
E damage (40% damage)
R damage (130% damage)
R heal (6.6% heal, in %HP)

And with all of that, you want to pad his AP scaling more? That's 150% AP in shield, and 6.6% AP in %HP heal. That in itself is pretty darn tanky, if done right (obviously). And damage Tank Ekko has damage, but clearly AP Ekko has the advantage on that. Utility is just there, and not necessarily hard to land with both builds having some forms of tankiness. I wouldn't say either build is truly lacking in any of the 3 areas.

Ekko's tank build does make applying his kit incredibly simple and risk-free, basically never having to worry about his tankiness between his build and his extreme utility, and still applying fair damage, particularly if you can power down HPs below 40%. However, AP Ekko gets remnances of that tankiness while absolutely killing it with damage.

So, where does this AP ratio proposal go wrong? Well, right now, Tank Ekko trades off damage for tankiness, and gets reliable utility out of it, whereas AP Ekko makes essentially the exact opposite trade (less tankiness and utility, more damage). If his utility were sapped in the tank build, his only advantage would be the tankiness, as the reliability of applying his utility would be scratched by the power of utility in AP Ekko. So, Tank Ekko would trade damage for basically nothing, and AP Ekko would really trade about nothing for high damage and *higher powered* utility. Right now, Ekko has 2 sharply different modes of play, and shifting utility to AP would only combine the 2 into an even more OP frenzy.

Stop trying to buff AP Ekko. He's not necessarily overly OP (questionable), but he's definitely holding his own. What needs to change is this assumption that Ekko's utility needs to be as game-breaking as it is. He has an extremely powerful assassin-type ultimate, and a second skill that basically functions like a typical AoE utility champion's ultimate (W), and both work just fine as is without any investment either way. Those two need clear paths to take, and the answer to both should not be AP.

And keep in mind, his "2 ultimates" only take into account 3 of his AP ratios, only 1 of which an actual damage ratio. There are still 5 more AP damage ratios that have nothing to do with his two quasi-ultimates. While those 2 are heavy factors in his kit, he still has plenty else to work with.

TL;DR: Don't give Ekko 9-10 AP ratios before he even gets a Lich Bane/Luden's Echo.
